progress.testsNote: Take Level Tests to prove your skills and advance faster!

tips.verbsQuestion: What's the best way to learn verbs?
tips.verbsAnswer: Use Learn mode and ask for conjugation tables. Practice all 6 persons (I, you, he/she, we, you all, they) together.
tips.partnerQuestion: How do I practice with my partner?
tips.partnerAnswer: Use phrases you've learned in daily conversations. Even simple greetings count! Create challenges for each other in the Play section.
tips.progressAnswer: 15-20 minutes of daily practice works wonders. Consistency beats cramming!
tips.forgetQuestion: What if I forget a word?
tips.forgetAnswer: Play games - they automatically resurface words you're struggling with. The spaced repetition helps lock them in.

section0.headline: Language learning that starts with love.
section0.copy: Built on Relationship-Aware Language Learning (RALL), Love Languages helps couples bridge the language gap‚Äîone meaningful word at a time.

section1.headline: Learn the sweet nothings, the spicy somethings, and everything in between.
section1.copy: Every word they teach you gets saved to your Love Log automatically. Real words from your real relationship‚Äînot a textbook.

section2.headline: Everyone's laughing. You're still translating.
section2.copy: Listen Mode catches every word you missed. Review them after dinner. Next time, you'll be in on it.

section3.headline: Six months from now: your first real conversation.
section3.copy: Intimate. Uninterrupted. In their language. With their help, you'll get there.

section4.headline: They're on the other side. Let them pull you through.
section4.copy: Your partner picks the words. You learn them. Somewhere between the quizzes and the flirting, you stop being a guest in their world.

section1.headline: There's a whole you they've never met.
section1.copy: The way you fight. The way you joke. The things you can only say in your language. Let them in.

section2.headline: Some things die in translation. Stop letting them.
section2.copy: You explain. They nod. The feeling's gone. They don't want your subtitles‚Äîthey want the original.

section3.headline: The first time they make your family laugh without you.
section3.copy: They said it. Your people heard it. And you realized‚Äîyou gave them that.

section4.headline: Your language is a door. Hand them the key.
section4.copy: Every word is a piece of you they get to keep. Your memories. Your people. Your home.

q1.question: What is Relationship-Aware Language Learning (RALL)?
q1.answer: RALL is our methodology that combines proven language acquisition techniques (Communicative Language Teaching, Task-Based Learning) with relationship psychology. Instead of learning generic phrases, you learn the words that matter in YOUR relationship‚Äîguided by your partner, who helps shape your "Ideal L2 Self."

q2.question: How is Love Languages different from Duolingo or Babbel?
q2.intro: Traditional apps teach you to order coffee. We teach you to make your partner's family laugh.
q2.point1desc: Your native speaker partner sends you words, creates challenges, and tracks your progress together
q2.point2desc: Learn THEIR words‚Äîfamily phrases, inside jokes, terms of endearment
q2.point3desc: No leaderboards against strangers. You and your partner work as a team
q2.point4desc: Your "Love Log" becomes a shared asset you build together

q3.question: What are the Student and Tutor roles?
q3.studentDesc: Students are learning their partner's language. They get AI conversation practice, vocabulary games (Flashcards, Multiple Choice, Type It, Quick Fire), and a personal dictionary.
q3.tutorDesc: Tutors are native speakers guiding their partner. They send "word gifts," create custom challenges, and use Coach mode to guide learning conversations. The Tutor isn't just teaching‚Äîthey're helping sculpt their partner's language identity.

q4.question: Which languages do you support?
q4.answer: 18 languages, any combination: English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Dutch, Polish, Russian, Ukrainian, Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Czech, Greek, Hungarian, Turkish, and Romanian. Learn Polish as an English speaker, or English as a Polish speaker‚Äîthe entire app adapts to your native language.

q5.question: How much does it cost?
q5.freeDesc: 25 chats, 50 flashcards, 1 voice session ‚Äî no card required

q6.question: How do I invite my partner?
q6.answer: After signing up, go to Settings and generate an invite link. When your partner signs up with your link, your accounts connect automatically. You can then send words, create challenges, and track progress together.

rall.label: Our Method
rall.title: Relationship-Aware Language Learning
rall.description: RALL synthesizes proven language acquisition methodologies with relationship psychology. The result: learning that strengthens both your language skills AND your relationship.

pillar1.title: Communicative Language Teaching
pillar1.description: "Ask Mode" prioritizes real interaction over memorization. You learn by communicating, not by drilling.

pillar2.title: Task-Based Language Learning
pillar2.description: The "Playground" scenarios use language as a tool to complete meaningful tasks‚Äîordering dinner, meeting family, navigating conflict.

pillar3.title: The Michelangelo Phenomenon
pillar3.description: Your partner doesn't just teach‚Äîthey sculpt. Research shows that when partners affirm your "Ideal L2 Self," you progress faster AND your relationship strengthens.

pillar4.title: Interdependence Theory
pillar4.description: Your Love Log is a shared investment. Every word saved increases commitment through positive interdependence, not fear.

rall.quote: "When partners affirm each other's ideal selves, individuals are more likely to achieve their goals, and couples experience enhanced well-being."
rall.anxietyDesc: Fear of judgment from your partner is real. Our AI mediates corrections and feedback, creating a safe space to make mistakes without damaging your relationship.

blog.label: Free Resources
blog.title: 1,000+ Articles for Couples
blog.description: Deep dives into cultural differences, romantic phrases, and everything couples face when bridging the language gap.

footer.copyright: Love Languages ¬∑ Made with ‚ô• for lovers everywhere
